00001 """
00002 ##@package datastructures
00003 ##@brief This module contains specialised containers. 
00004 ##
00005 #These are used to implement algorithms cleanly.
00006 """
00007 from random import randint
00008 
00009 ##@brief A class that works just like a queue or a stack, except
00010 ## that a randomly selected element is returned. 
00011 ##
00012 # This class is useful for implementing algorithms that gather 
00013 # elements, and need to process them randomly. Something along the 
00014 # lines of:
00015 # 
00016 # @code
00017 # while not rqueue.empty():
00018 #   #generates 3 new elements to process
00019 #   for i in range(3): 
00020 #     rqueue.push(process(rqueue.pop())) 
00021 # @endcode
00022 class RandomQueue:
00023         ## Constructs a new empty RandomQueue
00024         def __init__(self):             
00025                 ## The internal list to store objects.
00026                 self.array = []
00027 
00028         ##Returns True if this RandomQueue is empty.    
00029         def empty(self):
00030                 return len(self.array) <= 0
00031         
00032         ## Push a new element into the RandomQueue.
00033         def push(self, x):
00034                 self.array.append(x)
00035         
00036         ## @brief Pops a randomly selected element from the queue. 
00037         ##
00038         # All elements can be selected equiprobably
00039         def pop(self):
00040                 n = len(self.array)
00041                 
00042                 if n <= 0:
00043                         raise IndexError('Cannot pop from emty container!')
00044                 elif n == 1:
00045                         return self.array.pop()
00046                 else:
00047                         i = randint(0, n - 1)
00048                         j = n - 1
00049                         self.array[i], self.array[j] =  self.array[j], self.array[i]
00050 
00051                 return self.array.pop()
